---
title: Adson's Vascular Test
subtitle: A special test for Thoracic Outlet Syndrome (TOS)
---

:::{.callout-warning}
This test should be avoided due to the large percent of false positives @hooperThoracicOutletSyndrome2010
:::

# Technique
Pt is sitting arms at 15 degrees ABD, PT palpating radial pulse (this position theoretically tensions anterior and middle scalenes, compromising the interscalene triangle, 

:::{.callout-important title="Conflicting evidence"}
This movement is said to "compromise (compress) the interscalene triangle" but biomechanical evidence finds the scalene angle to increase, which should reduce likelihood of compression) @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020
:::

- Patient asked to inhale and hold breath @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020
- Patient asked to tilt head back, rotate head so that chin is elevated and pointed to examined side @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020
- Clinician records pulse as diminished, occluded and asks about presence of paresthesia @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020
